title: Desk Set fun script
content:
Does anybody know what font this is? I am baffled....I appreciate anybody who can help....This JPG is from a movie on DVD...the font was also used for the WB reality show “Starlet”...thank you!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Desk Set.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615181019/http:/typophile.com/files/Desk%20Set.jpg) | 52.49 KB |

 [‹ (x) Heritage logo - ITC Tiepolo {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615181019/http:/www.typophile.com/node/14955 "Go to previous forum topic") [Old receipt font?? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615181019/http:/www.typophile.com/node/14932 "Go to next forum topic")
author: wpixtvinc

comments.content: I don’t know, but the fact that the two e’s are different suggests that it isn’t font at all.

Ori, I thought that as well, but on closer inspection I think it is the same font “e” and that the whole thing was slightly skewed and manipulated (Photoshop?). That might account for the differing cap sizes between the “D” and “S”... just a guess.

My friend, are you talking about the old movie, 1957 — Walter Lang, Director; Katharine Hepburn, Spencer Tracy?

The Starlet is not the same.

- - - - - - - - - - - -  
Adjective5™ | Adj5™
